title: Philemon Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Philemon with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 1 chapters.

questions.question: Who wrote the book of Philemon?
questions.explanation: The book of Philemon is a letter written by Paul, as stated in Philemon 1:1.

questions.question: To whom is the book of Philemon addressed?
questions.explanation: Paul addresses Philemon, Apphia, Archippus, and the church in Philemon's house in his letter.

questions.question: What title does Paul use to describe himself in Philemon 1:1?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as a prisoner of Jesus Christ in Philemon 1:1.

questions.question: What does Paul thank God for regarding Philemon?
questions.explanation: Paul thanks God for Philemon's love and faith toward the Lord Jesus and all saints.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the communication of Philemon's faith according to Paul?
options: To become effectual by acknowledging every good thing in Christ
To gain favor with the authorities
To lead the church in prayers
questions.correctAnswer: To become effectual by acknowledging every good thing in Christ
questions.explanation: Paul prays that the communication of Philemon's faith may become effectual by acknowledging every good thing in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: What joy does Paul have because of Philemon's love?
questions.explanation: Paul expresses great joy and consolation in Philemon's love because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by him.

questions.question: On what basis does Paul appeal to Philemon regarding Onesimus?
questions.explanation: Paul appeals to Philemon for Onesimus's reception on the basis of love, not commandment.

questions.question: Who is Onesimus in relation to Paul?
questions.explanation: Paul refers to Onesimus as the son he has begotten in his bonds, meaning a spiritual son.

questions.question: How does Paul describe Onesimus's usefulness to Philemon now?
options: Profitable to both Philemon and Paul
questions.correctAnswer: Profitable to both Philemon and Paul
questions.explanation: Paul states that Onesimus was once unprofitable to Philemon but now is profitable to both him and Paul.

questions.question: What does Paul request Philemon to do with Onesimus?
options: Receive him as Paul's own bowels
questions.correctAnswer: Receive him as Paul's own bowels
questions.explanation: Paul asks Philemon to receive Onesimus as he would receive Paul himself, as his own bowels.

questions.question: Why did Paul want to keep Onesimus with him?
options: To minister to Paul in the gospel bonds
To take care of Paul's writings
questions.correctAnswer: To minister to Paul in the gospel bonds
questions.explanation: Paul wished to retain Onesimus to minister to him in his imprisonment for the gospel.

questions.question: What does Paul say about doing anything without Philemon's consent?
options: He would write a public letter
questions.explanation: Paul states he would do nothing without Philemon's consent so that the benefit would be voluntary.

questions.question: According to Paul, why might Onesimus have departed for a season?
questions.explanation: Paul suggests Onesimus may have departed temporarily so that Philemon might receive him forever.

questions.question: How does Paul describe Onesimus's relationship to Philemon now?
questions.explanation: Paul says Onesimus is not now as a servant but above a servant, a beloved brother especially to him and much more to Philemon.

questions.question: What does Paul ask Philemon to do if Onesimus has wronged him or owes anything?
questions.explanation: Paul asks Philemon to put any wrong or debt Onesimus owes on Paul's account.

questions.question: What personal promise does Paul make to Philemon regarding debts owed by Onesimus?
options: He will ask others to pay
questions.explanation: Paul writes with his own hand promising to repay any debt Onesimus owes Philemon.

questions.question: What does Paul say he doesn't mention to Philemon in addition to the debt?
options: How Philemon owes Paul even his own self
questions.correctAnswer: How Philemon owes Paul even his own self
questions.explanation: Paul says he does not mention how Philemon owes him even his own self besides the debt.

questions.question: What does Paul desire from Philemon in the Lord at the end of his letter?
options: Joy and refreshment of his bowels
questions.correctAnswer: Joy and refreshment of his bowels
questions.explanation: Paul desires joy from Philemon in the Lord and that his bowels might be refreshed by him.

questions.question: What confidence does Paul express about Philemon's obedience?
options: That Philemon will obey and do more
That Philemon will ignore the letter
questions.correctAnswer: That Philemon will obey and do more
questions.explanation: Paul is confident Philemon will obey and even do more than Paul asks.

questions.question: What does Paul ask Philemon to prepare for him?
questions.explanation: Paul asks Philemon to prepare a lodging for him, hoping to be given back to him by prayers.

questions.question: Who does Paul mention as his fellow prisoners in Christ Jesus in this letter?
questions.explanation: Epaphras is mentioned as Paul's fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT listed as a fellow laborer in the letter?
questions.explanation: Silas is not mentioned in Philemon; Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke are named as fellow laborers.

questions.question: What blessing does Paul give at the close of the letter?
options: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit
May you prosper in all things
questions.correctAnswer: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit
questions.explanation: Paul ends the letter with a blessing of grace from the Lord Jesus Christ upon Philemon's spirit.

questions.question: True or False: Paul commands Philemon to receive Onesimus back as a servant.
questions.explanation: Paul asks Philemon to receive Onesimus not as a servant but as a beloved brother.

questions.question: True or False: Onesimus was previously unprofitable to Philemon, but now profitable.
questions.explanation: Paul states that Onesimus was formerly unprofitable to Philemon but now profitable.

questions.question: True or False: Paul wrote the letter to Philemon solely as a formal command.
questions.explanation: Paul appeals out of love rather than commanding Philemon to receive Onesimus.

questions.question: True or False: Paul expresses confidence that Philemon will do even more than Paul asks.
questions.explanation: Paul expresses confidence in Philemon's obedience and willingness to do more.

questions.question: True or False: Paul mentions that he has written the letter with someone else's hand.
questions.explanation: Paul states he has written it with his own hand to assure repayment.

questions.question: True or False: Paul calls Archippus a fellow soldier.
questions.explanation: Paul refers to Archippus as a fellowsoldier in the letter.

questions.question: True or False: Paul asks Philemon to send Onesimus away permanently.
questions.explanation: Paul asks Philemon to receive Onesimus back as a brother, not to send him away.

questions.question: True or False: Paul refers to Onesimus as his son 'in the bonds'.
questions.explanation: Paul calls Onesimus his son whom he begot in his bonds (imprisonment).

questions.question: True or False: Paul writes this letter while he is a free man traveling.
questions.explanation: Paul writes the letter as a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: True or False: Paul sends greetings from Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke.
questions.explanation: These men are mentioned as Paul's fellow laborers who send salutations.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Grace to you, and _____, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.'
questions.explanation: Paul opens the letter with the blessing of grace and peace.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my _____.'
questions.explanation: Paul mentions Philemon always in his prayers.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on _____ account.'
questions.explanation: Paul asks Philemon to put any wrong or debt of Onesimus on Paul's account.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your _____. Amen.'
questions.explanation: Paul closes the letter with a blessing of grace upon Philemon's spirit.

questions.question: What is the main theme of the book of Philemon?
questions.explanation: The letter focuses on forgiveness and reconciliation between Philemon and Onesimus.

questions.question: Which city was the letter to Philemon likely written from?
questions.explanation: Paul wrote Philemon while imprisoned, likely in Rome.

questions.question: What kind of relationship does Paul want Philemon to have with Onesimus now?
questions.explanation: Paul appeals that Onesimus be received as a beloved brother in the Lord.

questions.question: How does Paul describe himself when appealing to Philemon?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies as aged and a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What does Paul hope will be the result of Philemon receiving Onesimus?
questions.explanation: Paul prays that communication of Philemon's faith may become effectual.

questions.question: Which of these men is NOT mentioned as greeting Philemon in the letter?
questions.explanation: Tychicus is not mentioned in Philemon; others are.

questions.question: What does Paul say about Onesimus's departure?
options: It was an act of rebellion
It was for a season that Philemon might receive him forever
questions.correctAnswer: It was for a season that Philemon might receive him forever
questions.explanation: Paul explains Onesimus's departure was temporary for a greater good.

questions.question: What is Paul’s tone in the letter to Philemon?
questions.explanation: Paul appeals out of love and gentleness rather than command.
